actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 106-59.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 25.
Mr. Franks moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 47.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation

official_title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol grounds for the Greater Washington Soap Box Derby.

summary.text: Permits the Greater Washington Soap Box Derby Association to sponsor a free public event, soap box derby races, on the Capitol grounds on July 10, 1999. Directs the Capitol Police Board to provide for enforcement of the restrictions contained in Federal law provisions concerning sales, displays, and solicitations on the Capitol grounds, with respect to such event.

titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol grounds for the Greater Washington Soap Box Derby.
